articles.author: FARNOUSH AMIRI and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Former President and GOP front-runner Donald Trump is in talks to visit Capitol Hill next week as Republicans debate who should be the next speaker of the House following Kevin McCarthy's stunning ouster, according to three people familiar with the discussions.
articles.title: Donald Trump may visit the Capitol to address Republicans as they pick a new speaker, AP sources say

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Lawyers for Donald Trump asked a judge Thursday to dismiss the Washington federal election subversion case against him, arguing the Republican is immune from prosecution for actions they say were taken in his official role as president.
articles.title: Trump lawyers seek dismissal of DC federal election subversion case, arguing presidential immunity

articles.author: STEPHEN GROVE, FARNOUSH AMIRI and LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — For Republicans, it's a question with no clear answer: Who becomes House speaker after Kevin McCarthy?
articles.title: Who might replace McCarthy as House speaker? What are Republicans already demanding for their vote?

articles.author: KAREEM CHEHAYEB and ALBERT AJI
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — A drone attack hit a crowded military graduation ceremony Thursday in the Syrian city of Homs, killing 80 people and wounding 240, the health minister said, in one of the deadliest attacks on the war-torn country's army in years.
articles.title: Drone attack kills 80 and wounds 240 at a packed Syrian military graduation ceremony, official says

articles.author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN and JAKE OFFENHARTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — A man who sprayed a New York City subway car with bullets during rush hour, wounding 10 people and sparking a citywide manhunt, was sentenced Thursday to life in prison.Frank James, 64, pleaded guilty earlier this year to terrorism charges in the April 12, 2022, mass shooting aboard a Manhattan-bound train.
articles.title: ‘Prophet of Doom’ who wounded 10 in subway shooting is sentenced to life in prison

articles.author: TARA COPP, LOLITA C.BALDOR and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The U.S. on Thursday shot down an armed Turkish drone that had come too close to U.S. troops on the ground in northeastern Syria, U.S. officials told The Associated Press, in a rare use of force by one NATO member against another.
articles.title: US shoots down armed Turkish drone after it came too close to US troops in Syria

articles.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russian President Vladimir Putin said Thursday that hand grenade fragments were found in the bodies of people who died in the Aug. 23 crash of mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin’s plane.
articles.title: Hand grenade fragments were found in the bodies of victims in Prigozhin's plane crash, Putin claims

articles.author: STEFANIE DAZIO
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A former University of Southern California campus gynecologist charged with sexually assaulting numerous students was found dead Wednesday inside his home, his lawyer said.Leonard Levine, George Tyndall’s defense attorney, confirmed the death to The Associated Press on Thursday.
articles.title: Ex-USC gynecologist charged with sexually assaulting students dies before going to trial

articles.author: PETER SMITH
articles.description: Mike Dulak grew up Catholic in Southern California, but by his teen years, he began skipping Mass and driving straight to the shore to play guitar, watch the waves and enjoy the beauty of the morning.
articles.title: America's nonreligious are a growing, diverse phenomenon. They really don't like organized religion

articles.author: CHRISTINA LARSON
articles.description: New research confirms that fossil human footprints in New Mexico are likely the oldest direct evidence of human presence in the Americas, a finding that upends what many archaeologists thought they knew about when our ancestors arrived in the New World.
articles.title: Further evidence points to footprints in New Mexico being the oldest sign of humans in Americas
